arm_group.description: A 2 x 2 cm section of skin will be exposed to LED light.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Minimal Erythema Dose narrow band UVB
arm_group.description: A 2 x 2 cm section of skin will be exposed to narrow band UVB light.

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to validate a new hand held light emitting diode (LED) device
      for the measurement of minimal erythema dose (MED) for narrow band Ultraviolet B (UVB)
      radiation by comparing to the traditional approach of measurement of the minimal erythema
      dose.

clinical_study.brief_title: Validation of a New Hand Held Light Emitting Diode Device for the Determination of Minimal Erythema Dose (MED)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        1. Age greater than 18 years.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          1. Pregnancy

          2. Lactation

          3. History of photosensitivity disorder

          4. Photosensitizing medications

          5. Personal history of melanoma or non-melanoma skin cancer.

          6. Skin disease on the back

arm_group_label: Minimal Erythema Dose narrow band UVB
Minimal Erythema Dose narrow band UVB

facility.name: Henry Ford Medical Center Department of Dermatology

clinical_study.official_title: Validation of a New Hand Held Light Emitting Diode (LED) Device for the Determination of Minimal Erythema Dose (MED) for Narrowband Ultraviolet B.

primary_outcome.description: The Investigator will look at area irradiated and evaluate for erythema. The lowest dose at which erythema is noted will be recorded as the minimal erythema dose.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Bio-equivalence Study, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Open Label
clinical_study.why_stopped: Under evaluation for need for further enrollment
